title: Miscompile when comparing function pointers

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
From rustc 1.4.0 through 1.25.0, the following code compiles and prints `true`. This is the way I would expect it to work.

```rust
fn main() {
    println!("{}", main as fn() == main as fn());
}
```

---

On 1.26.0 and 1.27.0, compilation emits a warning and we get a segfault at runtime.

```console
warning: constant evaluation error
 --> src/main.rs:2:20
  |
2 |     println!("{}", main as fn() == main as fn());
  |                    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ "Pointer arithmetic or comparison" needs an rfc before being allowed inside constants
  |
  = note: #[warn(const_err)] on by default
```

```console
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

---

On 1.28.0 the code fails to compile.

```console
error: this expression will panic at runtime
 --> src/main.rs:2:20
  |
2 |     println!("{}", main as fn() == main as fn());
  |                    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ "Pointer arithmetic or comparison" needs an rfc before being allowed inside constants
  |
  = note: #[deny(const_err)] on by default
```

---

On 1.29.0 through rustc 1.30.0-nightly (bb0896af1 2018-09-29) the code compiles but is not correct.

```console
Illegal instruction (core dumped)
```

---

Mentioning @oli-obk because your name is on this line so you may know what's up:

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/13931762e9832d215bb6ffcfbe4cbd126050b91c/src/librustc_mir/interpret/const_eval.rs#L377
